snippet.title: Open Alpha Release Demo: Wishy Washy
snippet.description:
Welcome to our Alpha Release Demo - a sneak peak at our FIRST EVER GAME about... window washing?!?! Get an in-depth look at the game's trailer, demo, and a Q&A with our project leads about the development process and how our first semester as a club went (especially after going all virtual)! If you’re interested in getting involved with Open Alpha, this is a great way to see just what kind cool stuff you get to do!

DOWNLOAD THE GAME at: http://openalphausc.com/spring2020
Learn more on our website: https://openalphausc.com
And sign up for our newsletter: https://bit.ly/openalphaupdates
Go check out our instagram: https://instagram.com/openalphausc

Wishy Washy is a 2D pixel art game about cleaning windows in a city of disasters. Nuclear meltdowns, giant squid attacks, and an aerial assault from a flying spaghetti monster have left this city in need of a deep cleaning, and you’re here to do it. You follow the game’s protagonist in their daily work life attempting to fulfill customer requests to wipe buildings clean. It’ll take swift, precise movements to finish your jobs before dark—before the next disaster strikes.

Wishy Washy is the product of the first ever cohort of Open Alpha, a student-run organization from the University of Southern California, affiliated with USC Viterbi School of Engineering, USC School of Cinematic Arts, and USC Games.

Also go check out the EXTENDED CUT to learn more about the leads' experience developing Wishy Washy!
Extended Cut: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o0LL-OZFQ3Y
